tag , each paragraph need to be seperated by two
tags, seperete between ingridients with
tag. in case of stages or instructions (like 1,2,3) seperate with one
tag as well. remove ```html and ``` from your answer.

hi i want a reciep with cheese included, external recipes:['Cheese Dip ["2 lb. Velveeta cheese", "1 (15 oz.) can Italian tomatoes", "2 small cans green chili peppers", "1/2 medium onion, minced", "3 cloves garlic", "1/2 tsp. salt"] ["Dice tomatoes and peppers.", "Combine all ingredients in top of double boiler for 30 minutes.", "Serve hot over corn chips."]', 'Cheese Ball ["2 pkg. cream cheese", "2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese (8 oz.)", "1 Tbsp. chopped pimento", "1 Tbsp. chopped green pepper", "1 Tbsp. chopped onion", "1 tsp. lemon juice", "2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce", "dash of Tabasco sauce", "dash of salt"] ["Combine softened cream and Cheddar cheeses.", "Add chopped up items.", "Mix and add liquids last.", "Mix well.", "Roll into ball and cover with chopped nuts."]', 'Cheese Ball ["2 (8 oz.) cream cheese", "2/3 can chopped black olives", "1 jar Armour dried beef", "4 green onions (tops and all)", "1/2 jar mushrooms"] ["Chop all and mix with hands.", "Form into ball and refrigerate for 1 to 2 days.", "Sprinkle with paprika and serve with Ritz crackers."]']

Cheesy Baked Spaghetti
This delicious and comforting dish is perfect for cheese lovers! It's easy to make and sure to please the whole family.

Ingredients:
- 1 pound spaghetti
- 1 pound ground beef
- 1 jar (24 oz) marinara sauce
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
- 2 eggs
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F.
2. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
3. In a skillet, cook the ground beef over medium-high heat until browned and crumbled. Drain excess fat.
4. Add the marinara sauce to the beef and stir to combine.
5. In a separate bowl, mix together the ricotta cheese, 1 cup of mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, eggs, parsley, salt, and pepper.
6. In a 9x13 inch baking dish, layer half of the spaghetti, followed by half of the meat sauce, and then half of the cheese mixture.
7. Repeat the layers with the remaining spaghetti, meat sauce, and cheese mixture.
8. Top with the remaining 1 cup of mozzarella cheese.
9. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Let cool for 5-10 minutes before serving.

Enjoy this cheesy and satisfying baked spaghetti dish! It's a great way to incorporate cheese into a hearty and comforting meal.

Worcestershire sauce", "dash of Tabasco sauce", "dash of salt"] ["Combine softened cream and Cheddar cheeses.", "Add chopped up items.", "Mix and add liquids last.", "Mix well.", "Roll into ball and cover with chopped nuts."]', 'Cheese Ball ["2 (8 oz.) cream cheese", "2/3 can chopped black olives", "1 jar Armour dried beef", "4 green onions (tops and all)", "1/2 jar mushrooms"] ["Chop all and mix with hands.", "Form into ball and refrigerate for 1 to 2 days.", "Sprinkle with paprika and serve with Ritz crackers."]', 'Cheese Ball ["2 (8 oz.) cream cheese", "4 c. shredded sharp cheese", "1/3 c. mayonnaise", "1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce", "1/8 tsp. garlic salt", "1/8 tsp. celery salt", "1/8 tsp. onion salt", "1/2 c. chopped pimento", "1/4 c. chopped olives", "1/4 c. parsley flakes", "1/2 jar dried chipped beef"] ["Mix all ingredients except chipped beef and parsley.", "Chill for 1 hour.", "Shape in ball.", "Roll in chipped beef and parsley until well coated.", "Keep in refrigerator.", "Serve with cracker (any kind)."]']

Classic Cheese Ball
A cheese ball is a delightful and easy-to-make appetizer that's perfect for parties or gatherings. Here's a classic recipe for a creamy and flavorful cheese ball.

Ingredients:
- 2 (8 oz.) packages of cream cheese, softened
- 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
- 1 tablespoon chopped pimento or roasted red pepper
- 1 tablespoon chopped green onion or chives
- 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional, for a little kick)
- 1/2 cup chopped pecans or walnuts (for coating)
- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, mix together the softened cream cheese and shredded cheddar cheese until well combined.
2. Add the chopped pimento or roasted red pepper, chopped green onion or chives, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, cayenne pepper (if using), salt, and pepper. Mix well until all ingredients are evenly distributed.
3. Using your hands, shape the cheese mixture into a ball.
4. Place the chopped pecans or walnuts on a plate or shallow dish.
5. Roll the cheese ball in the chopped nuts, coating it evenly on all sides.
6. Wrap the cheese ball tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to 24 hours to allow the flavors to meld.
7. Before serving, unwrap the cheese ball and place it on a serving plate. Surround it with crackers, breadsticks, or vegetables for dipping.

This cheese ball is sure to be a crowd-pleaser! Enjoy its creamy and flavorful combination of cheese, herbs, and spices. Feel free to experiment with different mix-ins or coatings to suit your taste preferences.
